channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [TIKA-189] Text extraction from Excel files juxtaposes cells
item.description:
I plan on using Tika to extract text from Excel (both .xls and .xlsx) files for indexing. But, I found that Tika juxtaposes cells on output. The example worksheets are in the attached .zip file.
I took the time to run Apache POI and it does not have this bug i.e. cells are properly separated.

When I run

-begin-
java -jar tika-0.3-SNAPSHOT-standalone.jar --text no_cell_separators_when_extracted.xls
-end-

I get the following output:

-begin-
Plan1
NameEmailSanta Claussanta@claus.org
Tooth Fairytooth@fairy.org
-end-

Same thing with a .xlxs file:
-begin-
java -jar tika-0.3-SNAPSHOT-standalone.jar --text no_cell_separators_when_extracted.xlsx
-end-

The output is:

-begin-
[Content_Types].xml

_rels/.rels

xl/_rels/workbook.xml.rels

xl/workbook.xml

xl/theme/theme1.xml

xl/worksheets/_rels/sheet1.xml.rels

xl/worksheets/sheet2.xml

xl/worksheets/sheet3.xml

xl/sharedStrings.xml
NameEmailSanta Claussanta@claus.orgTooth Fairytooth@fairy.org

xl/styles.xml

xl/worksheets/sheet1.xml
012345

docProps/core.xml
GeorgerGeorger2009-01-17T15:29:04Z2009-01-17T15:30:56Z

docProps/app.xml
Microsoft Excel0falsePlanilhas3Plan1Plan2Plan3falsefalsefalse12.0000
-end-

Also note that the values from docProps/app.xml have been juxtaposed as well.

This way, after indexing these files using the output from Tika, a search engine will only find "Fairy" when substring matching is used, because "Tooth Fairy" becomes "Tooth Fairytooth@fairy.org". This is suboptimal and wrong.

Thanks for your attention. Best regards,

Georger
item.environment: Tika revision is svn-20090116, platform is Windows XP Pro SP3, JDK version is 1.6.0_06.
item.summary: Text extraction from Excel files juxtaposes cells

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Excel file (both .xls and .xlsx) used to reproduce the bug.

Hi,

I face the same issue with xls and xlsx files. I have modified ExcelExtractor.processSheet() to add a space character to the handler after each cell value. Most search engines use a WhiteSpace Tokenizer so it should not be a problem even if this modification creates 2 space characters. This is the modified code

while(currentColumn < entry.getKey().x)

{ handler.endElement("td"); handler.startElement("td"); currentColumn++; }

entry.getValue().render(handler);
handler.characters(" "); //this is the added line

I would love to know if there is any other workaround.

xlsx files are getting parsed as zip files. Since the latest version of Apache POI parses Office 2007 documents, Can we add office 2007 document types to TIka mime-types.xml file?

Hi Kumar,
I tried your patch and it worked great for .xls files - would you happen to know what to change for .xlsx files as well?
Regards,

Georger

TIKA-188 (and before that TIKA-171) resolves this for XLS files. XLSX files are not supported by TIKA at the moment, so they are handled as XML files and only the text parts are extracted (without extra whitespace).
XLS files are outputted using <table> with <td> tags. TIKA-188 has an extension to the XHTMLContentHandler (see http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/lucene/tika/trunk/src/main/java/org/apache/tika/sax/XHTMLContentHandler.java?p2=%2Flucene%2Ftika%2Ftrunk%2Fsrc%2Fmain%2Fjava%2Forg%2Fapache%2Ftika%2Fsax%2FXHTMLContentHandler.java&p1=%2Flucene%2Ftika%2Ftrunk%2Fsrc%2Fmain%2Fjava%2Forg%2Fapache%2Ftika%2Fsax%2FXHTMLContentHandler.java&r1=734844&r2=734843&view=diff&pathrev=734844 ), that automatically inserts newlines (\n) and TAB (\t) characters as SAX ignoreableWhitespace. Any handler that listens to characters() and (ignoreableWhitespace) gets a good working text-only stream. TextContentHandlers does this.

Hi Uwe,
I read TIKA-188 and TIKA-171 and saw that they really solve this problem, but only if you output XHTML. I used the --text parameter, that's why I had to apply Kumar's patch. It would be nice to integrate this, because this way people are not forced to use XHTML output; my indexing engine, for example, would have to coax the text from the XHTML output AND THEN index the content. Parsing the correct output in a single step would be better.
As for .xlsx files, I saw that Poi supports them in the latest beta; it would be nice to see Tika support them as well.
Thanks for taking the time to investigate the issue!

Georger

The problem is another one: The current WriteOutContentHandler does not pass the ignoreable whitespace to the output stream for text only outputs.
When Jukka applied TIKA-188, he forget to implement ignoreableWhitespace in WriteOutContentHandler. Before TIKA-188 (thanks to TIKA-171) it worked.
TIKA-188 missed to implement ignoreableWhitespace() in WriteoutContentHandler.

Hi Uwe,
I checked out the latest SVN code, applied TIKA-189.patch and rebuilt, but got the same output.

Hi Georger,

sorry this was my fault (I only tested with a local open office file). The problem in this issue is not whitespace: Even the XHTML output looks wrong:

<table>
<tbody>
<tr> <td>NameEmailSanta Claussanta@claus.org</td>
</tr>
<tr> <td>Tooth Fairytooth@fairy.org</td>
</tr>
</tbody>

As you see, it is not a whitespace problem, it seems, that the ExcelExtractor forgets to insert a new TD element. I will investigate this a little bit, but I am not sure, if it is a POI bug or an error in the table cell loop.

The other small bug, I found in whitespace handling, is a new issue: TIKA-190

Hi Uwe,
I tried my hand at POI itfself and came up with a patch: https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=46544
The output POI gives me now is just what I want. But, I'd rather use Tika, because doing so I can have a single jar and command line, and stay away from messing with my CLASSPATH.
Hope this is helpful in some way. Also, as Tika is already using POI 3.5 beta 4, I second Kumar and ask if we can have Tika support Office 2007 files natively.

Uwe, thanks for the work on this! I'll give your patches a go over the weekend.

Re: Office 2007. Correct, we don't yet directly support those files, but see the patch in TIKA-152 for a starting point. I'll see if I can get also that committed in trunk.

Hi Jukka,

this issue is currently not solved and the patch is a duplicate of the new TIKA-190. The problem with the excel files is more complicated, it is not a whitespace bug as I suggested at the beginning. The problem is some error in the cell loop of ExcelExtractor, that misses to give a </td><td> between the cells to the XHTMLContentHandler.

But it would be good to apply TIKA-190.

Thanks,
Uwe
I was not able to remove the invalid patch for this issue and overwrite it with dummy.

I believe that this is a regression from Tika 0.2. It looks like the more recent POI version we're using has switched to zero-based indexing of rows and columns, which caused Tika trunk to concatenate the values of the first two cells on a row.

This is now fixed (for .xls) in revision 737581. See TIKA-152 for .xlsx support.

This is correct: When merging XLS/XLSX support in POI some old functions were deprecated there. The new Cell interface in POI uses getColumnIndex() and getRowIndex() with a 0-based counting. This is noted in JavaDocs of POI. The old functions are deprecated now, so the excel parser should use the new ones.
